definition: to piece together/to join together/to stake all/adventurous/at the risk of one's life/to spell

plate/dish/tray/board/hard drive (computing)/to build/to coil/to check/to examine/to transfer (property)/to make over/classifier for food: dish, helping/to coil/classifier for coils of wire/classifier for games of chess

sentences.english: You can imagine the spaghetti code when dealing with all of the browsers it must support.
sentences.chinese: 您可以想象一下處理所有支持的瀏覽器的代碼大拼盤。

sentences.english: The guests consume over 500yuan compliment mixed sushi or tenderloin.
sentences.chinese: 一次性消費滿五百元贈送壽司拼盤或特級牛柳一份。

sentences.english: The platter with balinese satay grilled chicken wings and fried so tong.
sentences.chinese: 拼盤有巴里沙嗲烤雞翅膀炸蘇東都真的蠻好喫的。

sentences.english: Because today our topic is "composition make fruit platter."
sentences.chinese: 因爲今天我們作文課的題目是“製作水果拼盤”。

sentences.english: Vegetable trays are also very popular.
sentences.chinese: 蔬菜拼盤也非常受歡迎。

sentences.english: Analysis of Selam's skull hints at a similarly piecemeal metamorphosis.
sentences.chinese: 分析賽蓮的頭骨，也發現了類似的演化拼盤。

definition: to arrange food on a plate/to plate up/food presentation/(watchmaking) balance wheel
to order à la carte/single point (of measurement, mounting etc)
to cook on a skewer/barbecued food on a skewer/shish kebab/(fig.) to perform or play songs in sequence/sequence of songs/medley
